A Hero

who captured the heart of an unlikely city

An Athlete

who found unlikely success

As a division II athlete coming out of a small school in Kansas Brian Moorman could not have expected a shot in the NFL.

But the Buffalo Bills signed Moorman as a punter in 2001 kicking off a remarkable career.

During his 13 seasons Moorman was elected to 2 pro bowls, 6-time team captain, an NFL All Decade team and the Buffalo Bills 50th anniversary team.

Moorman still holds the record for Buffalo's longest punt at 84 yards.

Although his job was to kick the ball Moorman's athleticism made him a constant threat in the backfield. A fake punt in the hands of Moorman would often result in a first down if not a touchdown.

Over his career he threw for 68 yards, 2 touchdowns and rushed for another 55 yards.

Moorman became a fan favorite through his leadership, character and intensity. Moorman never missed a start in his 202 game career.

A Giver

helping families fight unlikely odds

The character Moorman displayed on the field was an echo of his true character off the field.

Early in his career Brian and his wife Amber would visit sick children at The Roswell Park Cancer Institute and the Women's & Children Hospital of Buffalo. They would visit every Tuesday evening.

Brian formed strong relationships with the patients and their families. Brian and Amber pulled along side these families during their darkest days and would lend support to these families. Brian saw first hand how one child’s fight affected the whole family and desired to help these families who were already dealing with so much.

In 2004 Brian and Amber founded Brian Moorman’s P.U.N.T. Foundation to make a difference in the lives of children in Western New York who are fighting cancer.

Brian Moorman's P.U.N.T. Foundation helps ease the financial burden for the families, provides safe and enjoyable experiences for the children and their families and creates and outlet for others to get involved and help make a difference in the lives of these families.

A Hero

who captured the heart of an unlikely city

On the Field...

Moorman was the face of consistency and determination during a turbulent era of a football franchise.

... and Off

Brian Moorman's P.U.N.T. foundation has succesfully pulled along side hurting families for over a decade and continues to make a difference in the lives of children suffering from pediatric cancer and their families. The Foundation is now an accredited BBB charity and continues to involve the community in raising money and awareness to battle pediatric cancer in Western New York.

When his time as a Bill came to and end Brian Moorman wrote an open letter thanking the fans which ran in the Buffalo News on August 29th, 2014.

"To the patients, especially the kids: you are my heroes. Don’t stop fighting. You are some of the most courageous individuals I have ever met."

"To the survivors and the families of the survivors: I have only admiration for your roadmap on how to attack controversy, and your ability to be truly unselfish and wildly supportive against the longest of odds."

"To the families of those whom we lost: thank you for allowing my wife and me to be part of your journey."
